title: Cold Email Outreach Template
description: Professional cold email template for reaching out to potential clients with personalized value proposition
content:
Subject: Quick question about [COMPANY]'s [PAIN_POINT]

Hi [FIRST_NAME],

I noticed [COMPANY] recently [RECENT_EVENT/NEWS]. Congratulations on the growth!

I'm reaching out because I help companies like yours [VALUE_PROPOSITION]. We've helped similar companies in [INDUSTRY] achieve [SPECIFIC_RESULT].

I have a few ideas on how [COMPANY] could [BENEFIT]. Would you be open to a brief 15-minute call this week to discuss?

Best regards,
[YOUR_NAME]

P.S. I noticed you're [PERSONAL_TOUCH] - I'd love to hear more about that too.

variables.name: personal_touch
variables.example: involved in the local startup community

useCase: Cold outreach to potential B2B clients

title: Civil Engineering Project Planning Template
description: Comprehensive project planning template for civil engineering projects including timeline, resources, and risk assessment
content:
Create a detailed project plan for [PROJECT_TYPE] project: [PROJECT_NAME]

Project Overview:
- Location: [LOCATION]
- Budget: [BUDGET]
- Timeline: [DURATION]
- Client: [CLIENT_NAME]

Please include:
1. Project phases breakdown with milestones
2. Resource allocation (personnel, equipment, materials)
3. Risk assessment and mitigation strategies
4. Regulatory compliance requirements for [LOCATION]
5. Quality control checkpoints
6. Stakeholder communication plan
7. Environmental impact considerations
8. Safety protocols specific to [PROJECT_TYPE]

Format as a structured project charter with clear deliverables and success criteria.
useCase: Planning and structuring civil engineering projects

title: Comprehensive Code Review Assistant
description: AI-powered code review prompt that analyzes code for bugs, performance issues, security vulnerabilities, and best practices
content:
Please perform a comprehensive code review for the following [LANGUAGE] code:

```[LANGUAGE]
[CODE_SNIPPET]
```

Analyze and provide feedback on:

1. **Bugs & Logic Issues**: Identify potential bugs, logical errors, or edge cases
2. **Performance**: Suggest performance improvements and identify bottlenecks
3. **Security**: Check for security vulnerabilities and recommend fixes
4. **Code Quality**: Evaluate readability, maintainability, and adherence to best practices
5. **Design Patterns**: Suggest appropriate design patterns if applicable
6. **Testing**: Recommend test cases and testing strategies
7. **Documentation**: Assess code documentation and suggest improvements

Provide specific line-by-line feedback where applicable, and suggest refactored code examples for critical issues.

Context: [CONTEXT]
Framework/Library: [FRAMEWORK]
Target Environment: [ENVIRONMENT]

variables.name: code_snippet
variables.description: The actual code to be reviewed

variables.name: context
variables.description: Context about what the code does
variables.example: This function calculates user engagement metrics for a web application

variables.name: environment
variables.example: Production web server with high traffic

title: SEO-Optimized Blog Post Generator
description: Create engaging, SEO-friendly blog posts with proper structure, keywords, and call-to-actions
content:
Write a comprehensive, SEO-optimized blog post about [TOPIC] for [TARGET_AUDIENCE].

Blog Post Requirements:
- Title: Create an engaging, click-worthy title (60 characters or less)
- Word count: [WORD_COUNT] words
- Primary keyword: [PRIMARY_KEYWORD]
- Secondary keywords: [SECONDARY_KEYWORDS]
- Tone: [TONE]

Structure the post with:
1. **Hook**: Start with a compelling introduction that addresses [PAIN_POINT]
2. **Problem**: Elaborate on the challenges your audience faces
3. **Solution**: Present your insights/solutions with actionable advice
4. **Examples**: Include 2-3 real-world examples or case studies
5. **Conclusion**: Summarize key takeaways and include a strong CTA

SEO Requirements:
- Include the primary keyword in the title, first paragraph, and conclusion
- Use secondary keywords naturally throughout
- Add 3-5 relevant subheadings (H2/H3)
- Include internal link suggestions: [INTERNAL_LINKS]
- Meta description (155 characters max)

Call-to-Action: [CTA_GOAL]

variables.name: topic
variables.description: Main topic of the blog post

variables.name: target_audience
variables.example: small business owners looking to improve customer retention

variables.name: secondary_keywords
variables.example: email sequences, marketing workflows, customer nurturing

variables.name: internal_links
variables.description: Relevant internal pages to link to
variables.example: contact management guide, email templates, automation tools comparison

variables.name: cta_goal
variables.description: What action you want readers to take
variables.example: download our free email automation template

title: Business Requirements Documentation
description: Generate comprehensive business requirements documentation for software projects
content:
Create detailed business requirements documentation for [PROJECT_NAME].

**Project Overview:**
- Project: [PROJECT_NAME]
- Stakeholders: [STAKEHOLDERS]
- Business Objective: [BUSINESS_OBJECTIVE]
- Timeline: [TIMELINE]
- Budget: [BUDGET_RANGE]

**Documentation Structure:**

1. **Executive Summary**
   - Project purpose and scope
   - Key stakeholders and their roles
   - Success criteria and metrics

2. **Business Requirements**
   - Functional requirements: [FUNCTIONAL_REQUIREMENTS]
   - Non-functional requirements (performance, security, usability)
   - Integration requirements: [INTEGRATION_NEEDS]
   - Compliance requirements: [COMPLIANCE_NEEDS]

3. **User Stories & Acceptance Criteria**
   - Primary user personas: [USER_PERSONAS]
   - Core user journeys
   - Detailed acceptance criteria for each feature

4. **Technical Constraints**
   - Platform requirements: [PLATFORM_CONSTRAINTS]
   - Technology stack preferences: [TECH_STACK]
   - Security requirements: [SECURITY_REQUIREMENTS]

5. **Risk Assessment**
   - Potential risks and mitigation strategies
   - Dependencies and assumptions
   - Change management process

Format as a professional document with clear sections, numbered requirements, and priority levels (Must Have, Should Have, Could Have).

variables.name: stakeholders
variables.example: Marketing team, IT department, Customer service, External customers

variables.name: business_objective
variables.example: Improve customer self-service capabilities and reduce support ticket volume by 30%

variables.name: functional_requirements
variables.example: User authentication, account management, order tracking, support ticket creation

variables.name: integration_needs
variables.example: CRM system, payment gateway, inventory management system

variables.name: user_personas
variables.example: Existing customers, new prospects, customer service representatives

variables.name: platform_constraints
variables.example: Must work on existing AWS infrastructure, mobile-responsive

variables.name: tech_stack
variables.example: React frontend, Node.js backend, PostgreSQL database

variables.name: security_requirements
variables.example: Multi-factor authentication, data encryption at rest and in transit

useCase: Creating comprehensive business requirements for software projects

title: Interactive Lesson Plan Creator
description: Design engaging, standards-aligned lesson plans with activities, assessments, and differentiation strategies
content:
Create a detailed lesson plan for [SUBJECT] - [TOPIC] for [GRADE_LEVEL] students.

**Lesson Overview:**
- Subject: [SUBJECT]
- Topic: [TOPIC]
- Grade Level: [GRADE_LEVEL]
- Duration: [DURATION]
- Class Size: [CLASS_SIZE]

**Standards Alignment:**
- Learning Standards: [LEARNING_STANDARDS]
- Learning Objectives: Students will be able to [LEARNING_OBJECTIVES]

**Lesson Structure:**

1. **Hook/Warm-Up (5-10 minutes)**
   - Engaging opening activity related to [TOPIC]
   - Prior knowledge activation

2. **Direct Instruction (15-20 minutes)**
   - Key concepts to cover: [KEY_CONCEPTS]
   - Teaching strategies: [TEACHING_METHODS]
   - Visual aids and resources needed

3. **Guided Practice (15-20 minutes)**
   - Interactive activities for concept reinforcement
   - Student collaboration opportunities

4. **Independent Practice (10-15 minutes)**
   - Individual work or assessment
   - Differentiation strategies for [DIFFERENTIATION_NEEDS]

5. **Closure (5 minutes)**
   - Summary and review
   - Preview of next lesson

**Assessment:**
- Formative assessment strategies
- Summative assessment (if applicable)
- Success criteria and rubrics

**Differentiation:**
- Support for struggling learners
- Extensions for advanced students
- Accommodations for [SPECIAL_NEEDS]

**Materials & Technology:**
- Required materials: [MATERIALS]
- Technology integration: [TECHNOLOGY]

**Homework/Extension Activities:**
[HOMEWORK_EXTENSION]

variables.name: learning_objectives
variables.example: convert fractions to decimals and compare their values

variables.name: key_concepts
variables.example: decimal place value, equivalent fractions, fraction-decimal conversion

variables.name: teaching_methods
variables.example: visual modeling, hands-on manipulatives, peer discussion

variables.name: differentiation_needs
variables.example: English language learners, students with learning disabilities

variables.name: special_needs
variables.example: students with visual impairments, ADHD accommodations

variables.name: materials
variables.example: fraction bars, decimal grids, calculators, worksheets

variables.name: homework_extension
variables.example: practice worksheet with real-world fraction/decimal problems

useCase: Creating comprehensive, engaging lesson plans for educators
